author: adityapatwardhan
body:
* Changes to layout of package caused some changes to package path.
* Added Test modules from tests\tools\modules
* Fixed Get-ChildItem test
* Added convertor for converting OpenCover output file to JSON.
* Updated how the file is uploaded to CodeCov.io

<!--

If you are a PowerShell Team member, please make sure you choose the Reviewer(s) and Assignee for your PR.
If you are not from the PowerShell Team, you can leave the fields blank and the Maintainers will choose them for you. If you are familiar with the team, feel free to mention some Reviewers yourself.

For more information about the roles of Reviewer and Assignee, refer to CONTRIBUTING.md.

-->

comments.author: JamesWTruher
comments.body:
> function Invoke-OpenCover

would it be possible to check for elevated privs before starting the rest? I seem to remember that caught steve off guard

---
Refers to: test/tools/OpenCover/OpenCover.psm1:421 in 5ebfa56. [](commit_id = 5ebfa56c05a3479f37758d3d5ed6203741925fdd, deletion_comment = False)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @vors can you merge this so we can start getting code coverage data again?

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: @TravisEz13 Can you have a look at this and merge?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Please make sure that you add a meaningful title per the [contribution guide](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-submission).

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: I changed the title for you...  Hope it's close enough.

title: Make CodeCoverage tests work with CodeCov.io and related fixes
